Dear Raymond Moss:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager, Samantha Way at 517-243-9743.
Sincerely,
Nabiha Rizk, Licensing Consultant

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Institutions not detention institutions or shelter care
Title institutions; initial treatment plan
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4155
Section (1) The social service worker shall complete, sign, and date an
Description initial treatment plan for each resident within 30 calendar days of
admission.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation The agency has no approved initial treatment plan for a youth that
was placed at the facility on 04/03/2024. It was due 05/02/2024
and while it was started, it was not completed.
Investigation Complainant was contacted on 07/24/2024 via email. Youth A
was placed at the facility on 04/03/2024. The initial treatment plan
was due on 05/02/2024, but to this date the report has not been
completed. The facility was provided two trainings on MISACWIS
before Youth A was placed at the facility.
Foster Care Worker was contact on 07/24/2024 via telephone.
Foster Care Worker confirmed Youth A was placed on 04/03/2024
at the facility. Foster Care Worker was not aware that the initial
treatment plan was not completed timely.
Administrator was interviewed on 07/24/2024 via telephone.
Administrator reported the facility was provided with in person
training on MISACWIS, but Director was still having issues with
MISACWIS and that is the reason the report was not completed
timely.
Director was interviewed on 08/02/2024 via telephone and on
08/14/2024 at the facility. Director admitted the Initial treatment
plan report was started, but it did not get completed until
07/31/2024. Director reported she was having issues with
MISACWIS and therefore that was the reason the report was not
completed timely. Director admitted that contract office set up in
person MISACWIS trainings at the facility on 03/06/2024, but she
continued to have issues with completing the initial treatment plan
in MISACWIS. Director said she continues to work with the
MISACWIS help desk to get some of the issues resolved. Director
was informed the initial treatment plan report needs to be
completed timely and must be signed and dated.
2

Documents received:
• Initial Treatment Plan for Youth A, report period 04/03/2024
thru 05/02/2024. Report date 07/31/2024. Report was not
signed or dated.
• MISACWIS help desk ticket dated 08/12/2024 stating the
case has been resolved.
Analysis Based on interviews conducted and documents reviewed, this
violation is established. Youth A’s initial treatment plan was due
on 05/02/2024, but it was not completed until 07/31/2024.
CONSULTATION:
Consultation was provided to ensure all initial service plans and
updated service plans be signed and dated.
Conclusion Violation Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
